intro: Brachystelma pygmaeum subsp. breviflorum, commonly known as the dwarf starling flower, is a small, flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and specialized adaptations for arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that are typically pale yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its delicate structure and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
